text:
- Customers come to AWS to
build and run their application.
Now with myApplication views
and CloudWatch Application Signals,

you can actually see your
application inside of AWS.
- MyApplications is a suite of experiences

that allow partners to
identify an application,

apply tagging or identification
for that application,
and then manage cost, performance,
and scalability as a result.

The core construct
though, is the definition

of what is an application
across all of your resources.

With the core construct
of an application tag,
customers can identify these are,
this is a product I'm concerned about,
this is a software package,

this is a compliance
opportunity that I'm managing.

And then with embedded search
by AWS Resource Explorer,

they can connect with those
particular applications

across regions to see
cost, security risks,
or scaling opportunities.
- With myApplications in AWS console,
you can now assemble a logical application

out of a set of resources
and then complement it
by Amazon CloudWatch Application Signals.

The way Application Signals
works is it collects data

from all of your
business-critical deployments,

or code runs where your
dependency is getting exercised,
and then it makes sense of that data.
It creates insights out of the box
so you can immediately understand
whether your customers are happy

and whether you have any
issue to be attended to,

as well as immediately
establish a root cause,
whether it's in your code
or in the underlying infrastructure,
or in the managed service run by AWS.

- The myApplications
experience is extended
to the CloudOps Competency Program

so that our partners can
onboard with myApplications
and manage their resources

and drive efficiency
on behalf of customers.
- MyApplications and Application Signals
is out there in AWS.
Go ahead and get excited. We're excited.
Go try it out. Give it a ride.
Give us feedback. We love feedback.
We'd love to hear from you.
(upbeat music)
